tspan.tspan: Sugar is omnipresent in processed food.
Sugarcane is used to produce either sugar or
generate more than 279 tons of waste per year.
The sugar outcoming from this workflow still have to
undergo a few steps of processing to become
strong taste and is rich in nutrients, is commercialized
as such or used as a fertilizer.
are mostly used in baking, are a

text.tspan: Leaves and tops are mainly burned directly in the field.

tspan.tspan: year. In most countries, bagasse in burned to produce
energy. For instance, incinerating 1 ton of bagasse
generates about 330kWh of thermal energy. However
this burning results in non-negligible amounts of
bagasse ashes, which are themselves disposed in
Sugar industry is one of the main consumers of fresh
water in the food industry. Consequently it also
of several kind and if not properly treated are harmful
Press mud is rich in nutrients and could be used as a
The clarification step involves the addition of
chemicals. They allow to kill the bacteria present in
the juice as well as making the juice clearer.

text.tspan: Source: Sustainable Valorization of Waste and By-Products from Sugarcane Processing, Nicoleta Ungureanu, Valentin VlÄƒdut and Sorin-Stefan Biris, 2022.
